website_summaries.verdict: It’s not the most powerful processor on the market, but it delivers a solid level of performance at an impressive price point.
pros: Uses a quad-core design, which provides plenty of power for the average user
Includes AMD’s Wraith Stealth cooler to add to the value of this product
Will handle some games that don’t demand extensive processor performance
cons: Does not include onboard graphics processing, which limits its usability with graphics-hungry software

customer_reviews.title: Dont let the price fool you. the ryzen 3 1200  Overclocks like a beast  ON STOCK COOLER
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to update my motherboards bios so i could just buy a ryzen 2600x but. honestly this cpu does everything i need 4 cores 4 threads overclocks to 4.0ghz on stock cooler. i may still upgrade to the 2600x but i am content with the ryzen 3 1200 overclocked to 4.0ghz i play overwatch,CSGO skyrim wow Doom, assassin's creed origins. in my experience. i have a gtx 970. it will bottleneck at stock speeds but once you overclock it to 4.0ghz and set your ram to 3200mhz then the bottleneck goes away i can overclock my gtx 970 and get better performance now
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great budget CPU for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for my gaming pc build. Paired with Asus prime b350m mobo, ballistix sport 8g 2666 and pny gtx 1060 3gb. CPU oc to 3.8GHz. Cinebench single core score 150, multicore score 570. Rise of the tomb raider 60 fps at 2k resolution (high, smaa) . Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Siltbreaker

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang For The Buck
customer_reviews.text: It's a good beginners cpu for sure. Just a tip for people looking to build a gaming pc, I would recommend ryzen 5 just for the sheer fact it's just a tiny bit more money for way more performance. Please note Idk if "x" models come with a cooler. Please check before you buy. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Ryden

customer_reviews.title: Basic Build turns out to me screaming fast.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a budget cpu. This delivers all the performance I need for a solid desktop with some light gaming. Very easy to overclock (using only stock cooling so nothing crazy). I could easily have a gaming monster if I upgraded to the GTX 1070 from the 1050ti. Most games are only using 4 cores anyhow. Ryzen 3 1200 Samsung EVO 960 250GB NVMe Corsair Vengeance LPX 8GB (2x4GB) DDR4 DRAM 3000MHz (PC4-24000) NVidia GForce 1050ti 4Gb GIGABYTE GA-AB350M-Gaming 3
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E. Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Great Price/Value. I'm even able to do a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Price/Value. I'm even able to do a little bit of 3D modeling, although I wouldn't recommend it. I was able to overclock to 3.5 but anything over that is pretty unstable. Not every CPU hits the silicon lottery. Awesome stock cooler as well. Though if you want to overclock any higher I would recommend upgrading.
customer_reviews.author: SMG

customer_reviews.title: Dont set Expectations to high
customer_reviews.text: I set my expectations to high. And thats not the products fault. Its not meant for any AAA games. Not even on all low video settings. But it does perform fine for most esports. It lost a star because of how it came. I did buy 3rd party, but that doesnt excuse the fact that the title clearly says that the item comes with a wraith cooler. It came with a cheap aftermarket cpu cooler. I will be keeping this cpu, but just for trouble shooting and flash bios if i have to. All in all, $80 aint bad for what you get. The integrated graphics will come in handy for troubleshooting like i stated above.
customer_reviews.author: Codybuster

customer_reviews.title: It's 12nm
customer_reviews.text: The one I received was the new 12nm version (ZEN+), make sure your bios is updated. I paired this with the "ASUS TUF B450-PLUS Gaming" sold by Amazon and it included the latest (2008 version) bios thankfully. Unfortunately I can't tell you if it's any good for gaming, I quit gaming in 2012. It is good for my video and photo editing. It's been 24 hours and everything is good so far. It is better than my old FX 4100 Bulldozer, I can tell you that much. Very snappy and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: MikeFrett

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Literally the most pointless processor you can buy. No onboard graphics at all, so being a budget office CPU is out of the question because you have to buy a dedicated GPU too. The 2200G is $20 more and has onboard graphics so you can actually use it like it was intended. AMD what were you smoking when you made this CPU?
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: but I am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using it for about a month, but I am very pleased with it. My wife is a photographer, so I wanted to build her a system that could handle photoshop, lightroom, and other adobe apps at the same time. This new system handles it all with ease without putting much stress on the CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Before you buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Literally no problems with this cpu, really worth the money. However, in order for your pc to work, you will need a graphics card. This cpu does not come with its own graphics. You will have to plug in a vga or hdmi cable into a graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: AhmadF

customer_reviews.title: Solid entry into the Ryzen line.
customer_reviews.text: Charity-build for a disable neighbor who's idea of gaming is Angry Birds. He's happy with it. This is not a CPU suitable for AAA gaming, but if you're going to use the computer for homework, light gaming, internet work, and watching Youtube, you can't go too far wrong with an entry-level Ryzen CPU. If you decide to upgrade later, the unified Ryzen architecture means that you can upgrade the chip and use literally everything else in your case.
customer_reviews.author: MLT

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful CPU
customer_reviews.text: excellent CPU, overclock friendly. Some say using this CPU with a 1060 will cap the GPU. While what they say its essentially true, there is literally hardly any noticeable difference. I running this with a 1060 6GB, I play all modern titles and triple A games just fine. Unless you're a perfectionist and care about the 2-3 Frame rate difference, this CPU is perfectly fine, and as i mentioned before, you can overclock it to meet specific GPU specs, although I wouldn't put this with a 1070.
customer_reviews.author: The Real One

customer_reviews.title: Had it done by someone who is comfortable with this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the sort who mucks about in my pc's guts. Had it done by someone who is comfortable with this stuff. Now it's done and the pc is zipping right along. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: NotTechnicallyApt

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable performance for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this processor for about year now. I overclocked it to 3.5ghz on day one and haven't had a single issue with it. I could probably go higher but I like knowing I'm 100% stable. I recently upgraded to an rx560 4gb to replace my rx460 2gb and this $100 cpu still isn't my bottleneck. I play PUBG quite a bit and I haven't seen this little guy go above 35% usage which is amazing for $100. Temps are completely fine using a Noctua NH-L9a even after overclocking. Anyon considering the g4560 route, just don't. Go team red and you'll be happy!
customer_reviews.author: Bridger Reif Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Build you own blazing fast computer for less money - a lot less.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as simple as that classic MacPro desktop was to build and modify -- but far cheaper than trying to upgrade that old case. (I did that for a decade.) With a little help from Amazon, NewEgg, and a 14-year-old grandson, I now have a blazing fast new computer for about a fourth of the cost of a similarly equipped factory-build.
customer_reviews.author: P. Geis

customer_reviews.title: Incredible for the $ spent!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Fx 8350 since the time it was released and have been non stop gaming with it since 2013. It still is a decent chip that held its value all these years. But its starting to show its age with performence. Although its "8" cored, its being out performed by this r3 1200! You can not go wrong for the cheap asking price of the zen 1200. Couple it with 8gb ram, an a320 or b350 mother board and you will have yourself a budget gaming pc that will leave the ps4 and xbox in the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Kazimierz S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for office apps and light gaming.
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is perfect for everyday use and some good light gaming. Old games runs PERFECTLY at high settings (Provided you have a decent GPU) for newer games it gets the job done, just dont expect 60fps smooth on something like Control or Horizon Zero Dawn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with ANY graphics chip installed on your motherboard
customer_reviews.text: You MUST install a separate video card in the pc as this CPU is not compatible with ANY onboard graphics options. You will not even reach a BIOS screen. Possibly the worst cpu decision I have made in 26 years of building desktop pc's.
customer_reviews.author: K. Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Btw good cpu but not good for overclocking. [Not recommend for overclocking]
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok for gaming on med or high some games lag but it’s not ok for overclocking do not overclock it mine just blew long ago screwed up my plug out lit and now my pc is screwed. It was my fault btw.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Fast for cheap
customer_reviews.text: Wow ! Talk about performance on the cheap. Paired this with an nvme Samsung Evo and 8GB ram. Over locked easily to 3.9 GHz with a coolermaster 212. Could probably go higher with more Volts but I'm.happy with it. I have an old AMD HD 7770 which stresses CPU on newer games. The ryzen 1200 at 3.9 plays all games with moderate settings. Soon I am going to get a newer video card and this should get me 3-5 years for less than $600.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: A solid CPU for a budget price.
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered this for a friend that ended up not needing it. I then used it to update a BIOS to accept a 3700x CPU. I was going to return it, or sell it, but I decided to keep it as it's a solid CPU for basic functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Frisbie

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could upgrade the BIOS on the mainboard to support the Ryzen 2200G. The 1200 fit the bill and did the job perfectly. I did eventually build a system around the Ryzen 1200 and sold that system to a customer. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gosnell

customer_reviews.title: Nice CPU for budget pc's
customer_reviews.text: It is powerful but not by much. I mainly bought this to see if I could build a computer for less than $600. This CPU does what it needs to and it handles many games fine. My only concern is that every time I open task manager the cpu shoots 100 usage and then down to 40 usage. I would blame windows for that because windows 10 sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great silicon
customer_reviews.text: Absolute best once it's over clocked, on stock cooler I'm pulling 3.9ghz at 1.3v stable, games well, and temps stay pretty low, average about 29-34c. I didn't realise there were so many reviewers that can't read, the stars off for not having an APU architecture is the reviewers fault for not doing the're homework, this processor is amazing and currently 70$, can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect beginner CPU
customer_reviews.text: Installation is very simple and the included cooler allows for a great overclock. The vast majority of these chips will get to 3800 mHz no sweat, so go get a B350 motherboard or another that supports overclocking! The bang for your buck is outstanding with these AMD chips. Highly recommended to 1st time builders, value hunters, and AMD enthusiasts! My 1st build - CPU - Ryzen 3 1200 @ 3800 mHz Graphics - GTX 1060 3GB Memory - Patriot Viper Elite 8GB DDR4 (2x4) @ 2666 mHz Motherboard - Gigabyte GA-AB350M-DS3H
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only concern I had was stability wise to get a kit of memory to work nice at CPU speed
customer_reviews.text: Well for an entry level desktop CPU, I was fairly impressed. I matched it with a 1050, 1060 6GB, then a 1070 and the CPU wasn't bottlenecking as much as I thought it would. Plus well, AMD is back now!! Only concern I had was stability wise to get a kit of memory to work nice at CPU speed, but I don't think that's typically the CPU but more the motherboard or, most likely, the ram itself.
customer_reviews.author: Mederic Mausse

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, no problems that I'm aware of yet. I built a rig using this for my brother and so far he's not had any issues. Nothing technical that required me to troubleshoot any sort of error logging. So it looks to me like this thing is in great shape and no dead cores or anything. I'm happy with the results and it works really well. I always did like AMD products and this only improved upon my loyalty to their products.
customer_reviews.author: DBL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome alternative to i5
customer_reviews.text: I have always been an Intel fan, until I built my new desktop with this Ryzen 3 as the CPU. No problem running anything I ask it to. I would highly recommend going with the Ryzen CPU's if you would like to save a little money.
customer_reviews.author: Poisonremedy

customer_reviews.title: It does VR
customer_reviews.text: It can run VR. Watch a tutorial on YouTube if you do not know how to install. You need to screw the screws diagonally and not next to each other first. Get them screwed in a little and then tighten them up once they are all connected to the motherboard. Make sure the AMD logo is parallel to the I/O before you set it down.
customer_reviews.author: ThePrincessIsHere

customer_reviews.title: Supplied CPU cooler uses 4-point mount
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Great entry level gaming CPU. Con: Wraith cooler requires 4-point mount on the heat sink bracket. Won’t work with a clip style heat sink mount. I had to use motherboard brass stand offs to connect the two
customer_reviews.author: Watanabe Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great budget processor
customer_reviews.text: This is really all the processor that's necessary for a straight up gaming computer. Pair it with a fast SSD system drive and a GTX 1660S and you'll never miss the extra cores/threads.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Hauschulz

customer_reviews.title: bought this before i did all of my research, dont repeat my mistakes!
customer_reviews.text: this processor works. not much else to say, its nothing special. the cooler that comes with it is more powerful than such a little processor actually needs. if you are building a gaming PC dont be like me and cheap out on the processor. spend the money and get one that will last for years. i will be replacing this with a Ryzen 5 as soon as i can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: my name jeff

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen rocks
customer_reviews.text: Now I wish I had bought a couples of models up. But this thing has been rock solid and a huge speed improvement over by previous AMD Athlon II X3 455. Motherboard was under $90, RAM is a bit expensive right now, but I'm super happy I upgraded and chose to go with AMD.
customer_reviews.author: Steve  Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Actually not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Oriignally i thought the fan was loud, turns out a cable got into the fan without me realizing. Great cpu for the price. I use this for my budgie ubuntu work pc and it's enough multitasking for the job
customer_reviews.author: Lamonte

customer_reviews.title: RYZEN 3 GOAT Value???
customer_reviews.text: No integrated graphics support?! Even with that said, For $60 this has to be the BEST value for any processor of all time. I bought one to build a dedicated server for gaming. I am very impressed with how well it performs.
customer_reviews.author: m.i.a.elite

customer_reviews.title: Grab this!
customer_reviews.text: I snagged this cpu for a second pc for basic functions and not gaming. It is very fast, easy to install and runs like a champ. Value king I would say.
customer_reviews.author: KF

customer_reviews.title: No onboard video on this CPU so you probably will need a video card
customer_reviews.text: No onboard video on this CPU so you probably will need a video card. Nice speed and good price
customer_reviews.author: Keith Barber

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a trash processor. I wouldn’t waste money on it now with the new Gen AMD out.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S.

customer_reviews.title: Good budget CPU with a little overclocking
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU so far got it running at 3.8 Ghz at 1.2v. I can hit 4ghz but requires to much voltage but happy with performance and temps at 3.8ghz. The stock heatsink is good enough for 3.8ghz as long as ambient temps are fairly low.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.

customer_reviews.title: You can get a lot out of this CPU
customer_reviews.text: First gaming build. I can practically run everything even if the game says your CPU is out of date. (One note) If it doesn't meet the requirements of the game, then turn down your settings and keep an eye on the CPU temperature and CPU usage. To sum it up. Very great product, but if you can afford a better card I would go for the Ryzen 5 1600. Just a little bit more but can handle lots more, however; the Ryzen 3 1200 is a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good for its price
customer_reviews.text: Overclocks easily to 3.8-3.9 GHz. Amazing performance for its price. Coupled with a good gpu, it will run most games.
customer_reviews.author: deathbyfreezeray

customer_reviews.title: Works great....my bad
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know it doesn't work with an inboard video card. But it does work with external. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P.

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I built the computer I'm using now and it is the fastest box I've ever used. The Ryzen 3 1200 Processor Unit and cooler work perfectly. I haven't really tested its capability yet. I may not ever, but this thing flies. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nedly

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but still great.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this CPU for a cheap build i did for my friends birthday. he wanted a gaming PC. and this seems to have been much better than i expected. much better than any highend FX chip.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for the price. Pretty much an older intel i5
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU for the price. I have it overclocked at 4ghz and it runs games just fine with a gtx 1060 6gb. It hits 100% load in more cpu intensive games like overwatch. At 4ghz it's pretty much an older intel i5 like the i5 4690, but for 100 bucks. Overall it's a really great deal.
customer_reviews.author: JAwp

customer_reviews.title: Best budget cpu out there
customer_reviews.text: Amazing gaming value for the price! I paired it with an a320 mobo... i know its weak but it gets 55+fps most games on ultra settings with an rx480 4gb gpu. Would recommend by 1000 miles
customer_reviews.author: bradley Pretre

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU with 4 true cores
customer_reviews.text: Amazing CPU with 4 true cores! A great start to play most of Today's games just fine for anyone wanting to start PC gaming for the first time or get back into it after a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Romeo

customer_reviews.title: Great budget CPU!
customer_reviews.text: Great budget CPU! (Note that it does not include integrated graphics). Would be 5 stars, except the Ryzens have some memory compatibility issues - read very carefully about exactly what kind of RAM is supported, and at what speed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Horne

customer_reviews.title: An amazing CPU, I'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I love this CPU, I've been using it since 2018 and have it over-clocked to 3.9GHz to. It's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: JustaRandomGuy

customer_reviews.title: Honestly I love it! 9/10
customer_reviews.text: In all honesty came allot sooner than I thought, if your looking for a pretty good starting CPU for low cost I definitely recommend this purchase, mainly cause you do ofc get the i3 cpu but it comes with pre-applied thermal paste and a CPU cooler which really helps out on money so I definitely recommend for such a low cost!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Meyer

customer_reviews.title: A good cpu for the price...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cpu in 2017 and it is still working but as of now im starting to have problems with it. it worked great until it started overheating and decreasing in performance. This cpu would be a great temporary am4 socket cpu, but dont count on it for more than a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Koresh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect processor for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Perfect processor for gaming, at 1080p and 2k as long as you have a decent graphics card too. Point eing overall just strictly speaking about the processor its great! whether you are gaming or you want it to just browse the web its a perfect one.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Best speed for money for low level processes
customer_reviews.text: Super fast for the price. Also keep in mind this does not have a APU built into it. Even though the B350 motherboards have a video output the CPU does not have the APU so you will need a video card.
customer_reviews.author: Foamy

customer_reviews.title: Success
customer_reviews.text: My son got this to build a gaming desk top. It works well and he is enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: great budget cpu
customer_reviews.text: Very good budget cpu that is great for beginners who are on the borderline between p.c gaming and web surfing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Varde

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Over clocked to 3.7 gigahertz with stock cooler. 4 core 3.7 gigahertz for 100$, Intel cant beat that
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great price for performance factor!!!
customer_reviews.text: Im not a heavy PC gamer so this entry level CPU is more than enough. Great Value. Great Performance.
customer_reviews.author: Derek M.

customer_reviews.title: perfect for first build
customer_reviews.text: first computer build, overclocked to 3.9ghz / ram at 2933mhz added aftermarket cooler very stable for gaming, would use again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok for first timers
customer_reviews.text: Ok if you want to play small games not for big size games
customer_reviews.author: Rabiya Rehman

customer_reviews.title: I went for this over an i5 for my mom's early Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.text: Good bang for your buck CPU. I used this in combination with an ASRock AB350 motherboard in an ITX form factor build I built for a gift for my mom. Stock heat sink isn't anything to write home about, but with good case ventilation it keeps temps down to a reasonable level for an air cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Canaan

customer_reviews.title: Value and Performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first PC build and it is absolutely a bang for the bucks. With 4 core and 4 thread, the CPU can handle most of the game on the market. This is great for the value but if you guys looking for something more powerful and willing to pay a bit more, I recommend the Ryzen 5 2600.
customer_reviews.author: Huy

customer_reviews.title: Bottlenecks my RX570
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy if you plan to game this bottlenecked my rx 560 and my rx 570 with no other applications running in the background even with the lowest possible settings. But this cpu is great to browse and do simple tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Dom valdos

customer_reviews.title: Great card, great price
customer_reviews.text: Without sounding generic, the CPU was a steal at less than $100. It was shipped quickly and arrived pretty fast despite a clerical error, and when it arrived it looked brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy M. Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is a great buy for the price. The bundled heatsink did not initially work correctly, but after pushing down on its center I heard a "click" and not it works correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: A great CPU for my pc build works very well compared to my old amd a8 7600 in my old pc
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: For my son's computer
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my son's computer. He plays minecraft mostly.
customer_reviews.author: MrKoffee

customer_reviews.title: For the price its amazing
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what i needed it for. I'll be upgrading at some point but only in case i need better performance in the future. It has presented no issues though so overall good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great processor for $110. Cant find anything to fault it for. Overclocks to 3.9ghz easy.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Nice and functional for what it is
customer_reviews.text: CPU works great for what I used it for. Something I could use to get into and upgrade the BIOS on am4 boards. At the end of the day paired with a budget card like an 570 you can have a cheap 1080 gaming rig.
customer_reviews.author: chazzg5

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU for price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a computer I am building for my grandpa. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Rorie

customer_reviews.title: Good processor equip with a good video card you can ...
customer_reviews.text: Good processor equip with a good video card you can play almost any game on high or ultra. There hasn't been any slowdown at all since I bought this thing a year ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Lee

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money good for a basic pc
customer_reviews.author: Tech fan

customer_reviews.title: Great processors.
customer_reviews.text: Great processors.. All of the Ryzen series.. The performance and value is great. And the compatibility issues been mostly worked out on the board makers..
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Echegaray

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen!!! Such a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Great! Cpu. If you’re looking for a ryzen3 get this and overclock to 4.0ghz. It preforms just like the 1300x so don’t spend the extra $$ on that one. I am really happy with ryzen. AMD is really bringing the A game these days.
customer_reviews.author: marion culp

customer_reviews.title: Really good processor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really good processor for the price. Definitely overclock this to at minimum 3800mhz for the best performance. Just youtube how
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: ... for my first pc build and It's definitely a great entry level cpu
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my first pc build and It's definitely a great entry level cpu. Also I recommend getting a b350 motherboard for overclocking if you decide to buy this cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good little CPU
customer_reviews.text: Great cpu. I’ve had it for over a month and overclocked mine to 3.8GHz. With the stock cooler and some different thermal paste mine has never ran hotter than 51C. Can’t beat it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ben nathan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for light streaming/moderate gaming
customer_reviews.text: My 1050 pairs well with this processor and has minimal bottleneck compared to my old X4 880k. Overall great!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: very good processor
customer_reviews.text: very good processor/ fast and excellent response time At a good price and was pretty easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Martin Clearman

customer_reviews.title: Great budget cpu.
customer_reviews.text: Great beginning pc cpu, runs most everything I have tried to play. Recommend to a first timer building a budget rig.
customer_reviews.author: Alex.

customer_reviews.title: I basically got scammed
customer_reviews.text: When I received the package it had thermal paste all of the cpu and it also has bent cpu pins and the box looked like someone through it off a building
customer_reviews.author: Eric mancha

customer_reviews.title: best budget build processor to date!!
customer_reviews.text: performs way beyond my expectations, Wife and I both use for college homework and of course play game and streams videos and movies.
customer_reviews.author: John Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great budget CPU
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my first PC build and am very happy. Runs better than I was expecting and for a great price
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price point. I overclocked to 4.0Ghz without any trouble, max temps under load is 52C with stock cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Good budget CPU
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace some aging parts in my girlfriends' build that weren't doing so hot with her Oculus Rift. Along with my old GTX 950 and a b350 motherboard, this did the trick. Definitely recommend due to the price alone.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Ragland

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't expecting too much, but I was impressed with what I got out of it

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu
customer_reviews.text: Cpu runs a little hot on full load, but nice cpu for your money.

customer_reviews.title: This chip outperforms the i76500u
customer_reviews.text: POWER. Performs flawlessly, with the quietest stock cooler I've ever had. I'm a big fan of Ryzen now.

customer_reviews.title: Price performance king
customer_reviews.text: For the money this processor is an unbelievable value. You would spend at least double for an intel chip that can do what this little wonder does

customer_reviews.text: Price to performance this is a great chip. Also comes with a great stock air cooler. Huge fan of this line!

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful CPU
customer_reviews.text: Not much to complain about. It’s a great CPU, especially for the price. I would recommend this to anyone building a budget PC.

customer_reviews.title: Good cpu for a budget gaming build
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a budget build this cpu is great. No onboard graphics so you will need a dedicated gpu.

customer_reviews.title: Happy son
customer_reviews.text: My son did his research when looking for this item. He's happy.

customer_reviews.title: Good speed at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great step up from early intel I-5. Never runs hotter than 40 degrees C even under heavy load.

customer_reviews.title: Small but Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Might be small but it works really well. So far have it running stable at 3.8 GHz. Built my nephew a PC with this and a GTX 1060 and he loves it. Uncle brownie points achieved!

customer_reviews.title: Good Product.

customer_reviews.title: Great budget CPU, AMD for life.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and performance. I used the Ryzen 3 1200 to update my old Phenom II based rig. It's a budget CPU, but it's no slouch. It was a great value at $60.

product_meta.title: AMD Ryzen 3 1200 Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler (YD1200BBAEBOX)
product_meta.description: Style:ProcessorTrue, Unlocked Quad Core Performance for Gaming and Computing. Featuring 4 Processor Cores for Performance Gaming and Processing, With a Brand New, True Quad Core Architecture, AMD Ryzen 3 Processors Provide the Responsiveness and Performance You’d Expect from a much pricier PC.OS Support Windows 10 64 Bit Edition RHEL x86 64 Bit Ubuntu x86 64 Bit Operating System (OS) support will vary by manufacturer.
feature_bullets: 3.4 GHz Precision Boost (up to 3.45 GHz with XFR)
True quad core, unlocked CPU architecture
A future proof, VR Ready platform; Includes AMD Wraith Stealth cooler
Supported technologies are zen core architecture, amd sensemi technology, avx2, fma3
Maximum system memory speed is 2667mhz; Large 10MB total cache
